title: 1999/488/EC: Commission Decision of 5 July 1999 amending Decision 97/296/EC of drawing up the list of third countries from which the import of fishery products is authorised for human consumption (notified under document number C(1999) 1835) (Text with EEA relevance)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION
of 5 July 1999
amending Decision 97/296/EC of drawing up the list of third countries from which the import of fishery products is authorised for human consumption
(notified under document number C(1999) 1835)
(Text with EEA relevance)
(1999/488/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The Annex to the present Decision replaces the Annex to Decision 97/296/EC.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 5 July 1999.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 243, 11.10.1995, p. 17.
(2) OJ L 289, 28.10.1998, p. 36.
(3) OJ L 122, 14.5.1997, p. 21.
(4) OJ L 108, 27.4.1999, p. 57.
ANNEX
"ANNEX
List of countries and territories from which importation of fishery products in any form intended for human consumption is authorised
I. Countries and territories covered by a specific Decision pursuant to Council Directive 91/493/EC
AL- Albania
AR- Argentina
AU- Australia
BD- Bangladesh
BR- Brazil
CA- Canada
CI- CĂ´te d'Ivoire
CL- Chile
CO- Colombia

EC- Ecuador
EE- Estonia

II. Countries and territories meeting the terms of Article 2(2) of Council Decision 95/408/EC
AG- Antigua and Barbuda(1)
AN- Netherlands Antilles
AO- Angola
AZ- Azerbaijan(2)
BG- Bulgaria

HK- Hong Kong

HU- Hungary(3)
IL- Israel
IR- Iran
JM- Jamaica
KE- Kenya
LK- Sri Lanka
LT- Lithuania
LV- Latvia
MM- Myanmar

MZ- Mozambique
NA- Namibia
NC- New Caledonia

PA- Panama
PF- French Polynesia
PG- Papua New Guinea
PK- Pakistan
PL- Poland
PM- St Pierre and Miquelon
RO- Romania
SB- Solomon Islands

SI- Slovenia
SR- Suriname
TG- Togo
TR- Turkey
UG- Uganda
US- United States of America
VC- St Vincent and Grenadines(1)
VE- Venezuela
VN- Vietnam
ZW- Zimbabwe
(1) Authorised only for imports of fresh fish.
(2) Authorised only for imports of caviar.
(3) Authorised only for import of live animals intended for human consumption."
